column1: This set comes in a medium size box. The dimensions of the box are 10.3 x 7.5 x 2.4 inches and weighs 0.84 pounds. You get a small/medium size instruction booklet.

You get some really great parts in this set. You get a red snake, dark grey crate, two tan cockpits used on the door, two dark green sea grass, three grass tubes, two clear rings, a silver frying pan, a carrot, dark grey silver pot, a clear bottle, a clear pole, and a dark grey triple hook
column2: that holds the pot. The different color green, brown, and tan parts are really nice and really clash well together creating that Dagobah look and feel. The total piece count for the set is 229. Overall a really nice piece haul from this set.&nbsp

column1: All of these figures are exclusive to this set and don'
column2: t appear in any other set. All of them represent themselves as they are portrayed when they are on Dagobah.&nbsp

column1: You get Hermit Yoda in this set. He has a rubber head with his pointy green ears. He has a slight smile on his face which looks really nice. On the back of the head you have printing of grey hair which was a nice addition. He has printing on both sides of his torso. On
column2: the front you have a collar showing a brown shirt under the piece of clothing. You have&nbsp
column3: something hanging around his neck and there are three pipes stuck together on it (I don&#39
column4: t what it is but it looks nice). He has a brown belt with a little pocket of some sort on it as well. On the back you have the brown belt and some printing of wrinkles showing the shirt. He has short tan legs and a small brown stick.&nbsp

column1: I was very happy getting this version of R2. It was nice getting an R2-D2 figure that isn'
column2: t like all the others. This one has a brick dome with his dark silver and blue printing on it. There are a lot of dirt spots all around it. He has his two white astromech legs. The main body has all the usually printing on it like: the&nbsp
column3: three blue arms, white compartments, and a lot of mud on him. I love all the mud on him and this really makes a distinct version of R2.&nbsp

column1: I was very happy to get Luke in his Dagobah form.
column2: He has his classic tan hair and has a double-sided head. On one side he has a frustrated (not quite angry) facial expression and on the other side he has his eyes closed as he is focused on lifting the dark grey crate. He has clear back plate with a 1x2 light grey angular plate where Yoda goes to ride on his back. He has printing on both sides of his torso of his tan tank top. He has dark tan legs with a pocket on each leg. He has his blue lightsaber as his weapon and for his training.&nbsp

column1: The build was fairly easy and a lot of fun. The build was a little bit of an adventure not knowing exactly what you are building at the time, but later on realizing what it is. The techniques for the window and door are great and the door really captures the iconic look of
column2: the hut. The build took me between 30-40 minutes. Overall a fun build.&nbsp

column1: Overall this is a great set (Not for $30 USD), but is a must-have for any Star Wars fan. The figures are amazing and are great to get them in their
column2: Dagobah versions. The build itself really captures that Dagobah feel. The inside is really nice. You have a fold up bed for Yoda to sleep on, a small 2x2 table and a nice fire pit where you can hang the pot over an open flame. My only problem is that the pot with the handle doesn&#39
column3: t really stay on the hooks. You have some nice play features with this set. You have a catapult like thing to launch Luke (although he has a hard time staying in it), a rope hanging from the tree with a clear ring for him to swing on and another on the ground, and a clear pole to put the box on to have Luke use the force to life it up. You also on the top of the tree have a feature that launches Luke off when holding the rope. Both of the green sides and come out from behind the hut and to the side of it.&nbsp
column5: The 2x2 white plate circles really add a great look to having smoke coming out of the hut. I highly recommend this to any Star Wars fan and to add to your Lego collection in general. I do recommend getting this set on a discount if possible. All I will say is you will not be disappointed with your purchase. Overall I&#39

column1: the build of the set is a small representation of Yoda'
column3: Hut on Dagoba. The build has many different play features so you can recreate scenes from the movie,&nbsp
column4: with a rope that you can swing Luke on , a part on the side where you can hang him upside down and a feature at the back of the set where you can make him jump. The build also has a very well detailed interior that includes a flip up bed for Yoda, a cooking area and secret compartment. The set can also be put into different configurations by moving the parts of the hut at the back pf the build to front which makes it more access able for display.&nbsp
column5: the set also looks very good from the outside with some great little details like the window on the side and floating crate.

column2: of the set are a great selection with Yoda who has a new torso print along with a molded head and he is great to get in a small set. The other mini figure is Luke in his Jedi training Dagoba&nbsp
column3: outfit and he has brand new printing for his legs and torso along with a two sided head with exclusive expressions. He also ha a new recolor&nbsp
column4: of his original har piece. Luke is also equipped with his light saber and a back piece&nbsp
column5: so he can carry Yoda. The last figure is of R2-D2&nbsp
column6: that has some awesome exclusive muddy printing.

column1: Overall this is a very nice little set that i would recommend
column2: getting for the great figs and so you can recreate the scenes form the movie. However I do think that the set is a bit overpriced for the amount of parts and how much stuff you get so i would recommend getting this set at a cheaper price but besides that i think this set is great for both play and display.&nbsp

column1: ,TRUE,4,4,4,5,4 MartinT","2020-04-04T22:40:37.457Z","Must have, it is. Yes, hmmm.","
column3: ,sans-serif"">This set is an update of the 2004 set, 4502. It has been 14 years between that set and this new updated one.
,sans-serif"">The 2004 set had a swamp edition of the x-wing and a hut. In this updated set you get Yodas hut with a training field. A small x-wing would be nice to include.
,sans-serif"">Minifigures
,sans-serif"">The minifigures is perfect and unique. They are also exclusive to this set.

,sans-serif"">Yoda is in his Dagobah outfit, not The Clone Wars outfit we see in many sets with Yoda. It is nice that he can piggyback on Luke, but he is too high up. If he sits five millimeter lower, it would be perfect.
,sans-serif"">This R2-D2 is unique, because he has dirt print.
,sans-serif"">Luke has his training outfit and his second face is very useful when playing.
,sans-serif"">The build

,sans-serif"">The building experience is fun and interesting. You start building in 2D (a platform) with bag number 1 and in 3D (the hut) with bag number 2. It is a solid and well-built set. It is also nice to see how we can build with curved corner.
,sans-serif"">I loved all the curved/bow bricks and all the circle plates.
,sans-serif"">Fun fact: I use brickset.com while I building to check for name and color for the pieces. That way I learn a lot.
,sans-serif"">Design
,sans-serif"">This set is half Yodas hut and half training field. It is a compact and small set.

,sans-serif"">The colors for the set are good, but the bright color (brick yellow) for the hut is too light. It looks like a set from Tatooine. It should be darker, should use more of the pieces with the sand yellow color.
,sans-serif"">The hut is very nice and detailed. The shapes for the front of the hut is amazing. The vegetation pieces complete the hut. The inside is also very detailed.

,sans-serif"">There are two hidden rooms in the hut. One under the table and one on the roof. The room on the roof is for the snake because of a small opening on the side. The room under the table is for storage.

,sans-serif"">The training field consist of two hinged pieces (left and right piece) and small piece in the middle. It is nice to have the hinged pieces, but they could need some improvements. They should have a lock of some sort, because they are too loose.
,sans-serif"">Features
,sans-serif"">This set is both a playing set and a display set.

,sans-serif"">The are many playing feature in this set. The best part with this set is that you can create so many iconic scenes from Dagobah. Both inside the hut with Yoda and outside with the training. There is also a window where R2-D2 can look inside, just like in the movie. All the playing feature works very good and are well built.
,sans-serif"">If you want to display the set on a shelf, you can remove all the training pieces and fold out the sides. And put Yoda in the door opening, now the hut looks amazing on the shelf.
,sans-serif"">Conclusion

,sans-serif"">This is now my favorite LEGO Star Wars set. I am very happy that LEGO made a new and updated version of the 2004 set. Yodas hut is one of the most nostalgic of the original trilogy. It is also nice that this new set is good for recreating all the scenes from Dagobah. Both playing and displaying. The hut is also very accurate to the movie.
